item.title: Security onion in Hyper-V
item.description: If you want to setup a real lab to test Network Security Monitor solution, like Security Onion probably you will start with some virtual machine where to install everything. While we can agree that VmWare is probably the best solution (I have a test ESXi node) Hyper-V can be a viable solution, but you need to be aware of some glitches. Most of the information I’ve found in internet are outdated and probably not valid for Windows Server 2019, as you can see in Figure 2.
